snippet: Some 40 percent were found to support giving up any ability to produce nuclear arms in exchange for lifting sanctions.
abstract: Institute for Policy and Strategy at the Interdisciplinary Center in Herzliya, Israel, releases unusual public opinion survey indicating that 40 percent of Iranians are willing to give up any future ability to produce nuclear weapons in exchange for full removal of sanctions; nearly 40 percent of those asked also agreed that Iran should recognize Israel if peace accord is reached with Palestinians and Israel withdraws from contested territories.
lead_paragraph: Some 40 percent were found to support giving up any ability to produce nuclear arms in exchange for lifting sanctions.

headline.main: Openness on Israeli Issues Seen in Survey of Iranians
